edu.mtu.cs3421.voto.VotoComponents

Class UDPclient

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.mtu.cs3421.voto.VotoComponents.UDPclient

  • public class UDPclient
extends java.lang.Object
    Created for Voto By: Nicholas Schweikart on 2/3/17. Description: Builds an API around multiple UDP sockets for communication with the Voto host.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  UDPclient.Handshake
      This handles handshaking with a Voto Host.
      private class  UDPclient.InitAll
      Initializes the UDP stuff.
      private class  UDPclient.MediaLoader
      This class allows for the background loading of all session media slides.
      (package private) class  UDPclient.MediaResponse 
      static interface  UDPclient.UDPServiceListener 
      private class  UDPclient.Voter
      Simplifies the task of sending a Vote reliably to the host over a UDP socket.

      • UDPclient

        public UDPclient(UDPclient.UDPServiceListener listener,
                 java.lang.String HOST_IP_STRING,
                 java.lang.String myID)
        Creates and initializes a UDP client for all transactions with Voto host.
        Parameters:
        listener - UDPclient.UDPServiceListener
        HOST_IP_STRING - Your indented hosts IP address
        myID - Your ID for this session.

        public void stop()

      • sendMessage

        private byte[] sendMessage(java.net.DatagramPacket packet,
                           java.net.DatagramSocket socket,
                           int bufferSize,
                           int timeout)
        Implements a reliable send over the UDP socket. It will attempted to send your packet 6 times, on error will return a null value.
        Parameters:
        packet - the DataGram Packet to send
        socket - the Datagram socket you wish to use for this transaction
        bufferSize - the size of the response buffer to use
        timeout - the timout this socket should use
        Returns:
        null if error, or the byte[] message response.

      • getDatagramSocket

        private java.net.DatagramSocket getDatagramSocket()
        Gets a new Datagram socket for you.
        Returns:
        a new Datagram socket, or null if error.
